####################################################################### # Write release version name and number which # is (indirectly) provided by user (in environment variables).
# NOTE: The environment variables are propagated from dynamic build # descriptor captured at the start of `release_pipeline`. # For other pipelines some defaults are expected to be set.
echo "${RELEASE_VERSION_NAME}" | python ${KEY_SETTER_PYTHON_SCRIPT} ${JOB_DYN_BUILD_DESC_PATH} "{{ pillar['project_name'] }}_version_name"
# Version number is different. # It is only set when variable `RELEASE_VERSION_NUMBER` is set. if [ -n "${RELEASE_VERSION_NUMBER:-}" ] then echo "${RELEASE_VERSION_NUMBER}" | python ${KEY_SETTER_PYTHON_SCRIPT} ${JOB_DYN_BUILD_DESC_PATH} "{{ pillar['project_name'] }}_version_number" else # TODO: Should the `*_version_number` key be deleted? # - If the key is propagated from `init_pipeline`, # then key may be completely deleted as whatever # is build there is a snapshot. # - If the key is propagated from `package_pipeline`, # the key cannot be deleted because it may be # packaging of release which should have # correct version number inside dyn build desc. # - If the key is propagated from `release_pipeline`, # then key may be deleted as not set by user. echo "Nothing to do." fi
####################################################################### # Commit setting of version name and number.

git reset git status

####################################################################### # Fast-forward merge source and target pillars. # This is a special case when `TARGET_PROFILE_NAME` is undefined. # This case applies to both `deploy_pipeline` and `release_pipeline`. # It does not apply to `package_pipeline`. # FORWARD: Update (fast-forward merge) # target pillars repo from # source pillars repo.
cd "${SOURCE_PROFILE_REPO_PATH}"
CURRENT_SOURCE_PILLAR_BRANCH="$(git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD)" BUILD_BRANCH="$(python ${KEY_GETTER_PYTHON_SCRIPT} ${JOB_DYN_BUILD_DESC_PATH} "build_branches:{{ source_profile_repo_id }}")" test "${CURRENT_SOURCE_PILLAR_BRANCH}" == "${BUILD_BRANCH}"
cd -
# NOTE: `TARGET_PROFILE_NAME` is only defined for `package_pipeline` # in which case nothing needs to be done. # For `deploy_pipeline` and `release_pipeline` # (when `TARGET_PROFILE_NAME` is undefined) # it should fast-forward into `SALT_PROFILE_NAME`. cd "${TARGET_PROFILE_REPO_PATH}" if [ -z "${TARGET_PROFILE_NAME:-}" ] then
CURRENT_TARGET_PILLAR_BRANCH="$(git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD)" BUILD_BRANCH="$(python ${KEY_GETTER_PYTHON_SCRIPT} ${JOB_DYN_BUILD_DESC_PATH} "build_branches:{{ target_profile_repo_id }}")" test "${CURRENT_TARGET_PILLAR_BRANCH}" == "${BUILD_BRANCH}"
# Update target profile pillars repo from source profile pillars repo. git pull --ff-only "${SOURCE_PROFILE_REPO_PATH}" "${CURRENT_SOURCE_PILLAR_BRANCH}"
# Record `latest_commit_ids`. CURRENT_COMMIT_ID="$(git rev-parse --verify HEAD)" echo "${CURRENT_COMMIT_ID}" | python "${KEY_SETTER_PYTHON_SCRIPT}" "${JOB_DYN_BUILD_DESC_PATH}" "latest_commit_ids:{{ target_profile_repo_id }}"
fi cd -
####################################################################### # This job has two dynamic build descriptor transfer modes: # - `package_pipeline` # In this case the transfer is done to target pillar repository. # This is to embed dynamic build descriptor into # "overrides" pillars for the selected target environment. # - `deploy_pipeline` or `release_pipeline` # In this case the transfer is done to project states repository # (to provide released dynamic build descriptor in "defaults"). # To tell the difference between the two modes, # `TARGET_PROFILE_NAME` build parameter.
# Get location of build history repo. {% set build_history_repo_id = get_repository_id_by_role('build_history_role') %} {% set repo_config = pillar['system_features']['deploy_environment_sources']['source_repositories'][build_history_repo_id]['git'] %} export BUILD_HISTORY_REPO_PATH="{{ get_system_host_primary_user_posix_home(repo_config['source_system_host']) }}/{{ repo_config['origin_uri_ssh_path'] }}"
# Get location of project states repo. {% set project_states_repo_id = get_repository_id_by_role('project_states_role') %} {% set repo_config = pillar['system_features']['deploy_environment_sources']['source_repositories'][project_states_repo_id]['git'] %} export PROJECT_STATES_REPO_PATH="{{ get_system_host_primary_user_posix_home(repo_config['source_system_host']) }}/{{ repo_config['origin_uri_ssh_path'] }}"
cd "${BUILD_HISTORY_REPO_PATH}"
CURRENT_BRANCH="$(git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD)" BUILD_BRANCH="$(python ${KEY_GETTER_PYTHON_SCRIPT} ${JOB_DYN_BUILD_DESC_PATH} "build_branches:{{ build_history_repo_id }}")" test "${CURRENT_BRANCH}" == "${BUILD_BRANCH}"
if [ -n "${TARGET_PROFILE_NAME:-}" ] then export TRANSFER_DESTINATION_REPO_PATH="${TARGET_PROFILE_REPO_PATH}" else export TRANSFER_DESTINATION_REPO_PATH="${PROJECT_STATES_REPO_PATH}" fi
cd -
# Transfer dynamic build descriptor with recorded `latest_commit_ids` # of target repository before transfer and after transfer. # IMPORTANT: Note how copy is done first (before changes in # target repositry can be committed) - this leaves # transferred dynamic build descriptor with # previous `latest_commit_ids` (as commit id cannot be # known until commit is done). Then second transfer # is done and committed dynamic build descriptor # points to the required commits ids.
for COMMENT_CASE in \ "with previous latest_commit_ids" \ "with latest_commit_ids containing updated dynamic build descriptor" \
do
cp "${JOB_DYN_BUILD_DESC_PATH}" "${TRANSFER_DESTINATION_REPO_PATH}/pillars/profile/dynamic_build_descriptor.yaml"
cd "${TRANSFER_DESTINATION_REPO_PATH}"
# NOTE: Without `add --all` `diff-index` will not notice untracked files. git add --all
# Make sure repository became dirty, otherwise fail. # NOTE: The only known reason why repository is not dirty can be # if this dyn build desc was already transfered before. # However, any new pipeline which uses this job template # leaves changes in the build descriptor making clean # repository state impossible. if git diff-index --ignore-submodules=dirty --exit-code HEAD then if [ "${JOB_STATUS}" -lt '2' ] then JOB_STATUS='2' fi fi
# Display status. git status
# Commit only if there are changes. # Ignore dirty content in submodules because there is no way to # commit them from top-level repo anyway (and all dirty content # will be committed by children). git diff-index --ignore-submodules=dirty --exit-code HEAD || git commit --author "${AUTO_COMMIT_GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL}" -m "Auto-commit: provide dynamic build descriptor at ${JOB_NAME} ${COMMENT_CASE}"
# Record `latest_commit_ids`. CURRENT_COMMIT_ID="$(git rev-parse --verify HEAD)" if [ -n "${TARGET_PROFILE_NAME:-}" ] then echo "${CURRENT_COMMIT_ID}" | python "${KEY_SETTER_PYTHON_SCRIPT}" "${JOB_DYN_BUILD_DESC_PATH}" "latest_commit_ids:{{ target_profile_repo_id }}" else echo "${CURRENT_COMMIT_ID}" | python "${KEY_SETTER_PYTHON_SCRIPT}" "${JOB_DYN_BUILD_DESC_PATH}" "latest_commit_ids:{{ project_states_repo_id }}" fi
git reset git status
cd -
done
